intro: Chamaeraphis neurodes, commonly known as the narrowleaf glassworts, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of the northern hemisphere. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, greenish flowers. The plant thrives in saline or brackish environments, often found in marshes, estuaries, and tidal flats. Its leaves are typically narrow and linear, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Chamaeraphis neurodes is adapted to withstand high salt concentrations and fluctuating water levels, making it an important component of coastal ecosystems.
